@mamun777 i guess he uses Handbrake. thats for me the best convertion tool. Converting a 4-5 Gb takes in my Mac about 5 hours. A 1080p will take loooooong.
@tr108 ~ I use Handbrake for .mkv files too, I'd like to know if you do, and whether you stray far from the ATV2 preset?

@donotcare-- I probably won't get to the other H&K movies, or any TV shows beside the Justice League Unlimited animated series, till the summer. If I'm still around then, remind me :) 

To everyone asking-- yes, I use HandBrake (the nightly builds from https://build.handbrake.fr/) on my Mac. I actually still use the ATV G1 preset with adjustments (Constant Quality 22 or 21, AC3 to 384 Kbps, and tweaks in the Advanced tab). If I used the ATV2 settings, my encodes might even be 5-10% smaller but that would eliminate the G1 people. Perhaps in the near future, as ATV3's start multiplying, I'll move things over to the G2 preset tho...
